definition: seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: What did these tattoos look like?
sentences.chinese: 这些纹身看起来像什么？

sentences.english: The boys are seen with some style changes and dramatic smoky eye make up.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们看起来造型有了些变化，而且还化了烟熏妆。

sentences.english: You and your agent are looking like hogs about now.
sentences.chinese: 你跟你的经纪人现在看起来就像肥猪。

sentences.english: Xiaowen looks just like all her classmates.
sentences.chinese: 小文看起来就像她所有的同学一样。

sentences.english: Carlo Ancelotti's side doesn't look to be in top form.
sentences.chinese: 安切落蒂的队伍看起来不在最佳状态。

sentences.english: It looks like the momentum is growing for a shift towards stream-oriented approach to UI.
sentences.chinese: 看起来UI转向面向数据流方式的势头渐劲。

sentences.english: You look as well as you did ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 你的身体看起来还和十年前一样好。

sentences.english: Put some greenery along the mantle to soften the edge a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 沿着壁炉架摆放了一些绿叶以使边线看起来柔和一点。

sentences.english: The wall behind looks a bit grey and dull.
sentences.chinese: 后面那堵墙看起来有点灰暗。

sentences.english: He seems to be grief-stricken due to the loss of a friend.
sentences.chinese: 他看起来极度忧伤是因为失去了一个朋友。

sentences.english: Pregnancy has you looking better than ever
sentences.chinese: 你怀孕后看起来比以前任何时候都美。

sentences.english: It seemed more new-user-friendly that way.
sentences.chinese: 这看起来对新用户来说更为友好。

sentences.english: Spoelstra, however, seemed to miss the most relevant point.
sentences.chinese: 但是，看起来斯波尔斯特拉错过了那个最关键的问题。

sentences.english: so it looked like they've been blown apart.
sentences.chinese: 使其看起来像被炸得分裂了一样。

sentences.english: As such this contribution is rather a blatant example of ego-tripping and questionable self-promotion on the part of the author.
sentences.chinese: 所以，这看起来更像是作者的自吹自擂和自我宣传。

definition: to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
to appear to be/to seem as if
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
